trans-unit.source: The ISEFile Object
trans-unit.target: The ISEFile Object

trans-unit.source: powershell,cmdlet
trans-unit.target: powershell,cmdlet

trans-unit.source: The ISEFile Object
trans-unit.target: The ISEFile Object

trans-unit.source: An **ISEFile** object represents a file in Windows PowerShellÂ® Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE).
trans-unit.target: An **ISEFile** object represents a file in Windows PowerShellÂ® Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE).

trans-unit.source: It is an instance of the Microsoft.PowerShell.Host.ISE.ISEFile class.
trans-unit.target: It is an instance of the Microsoft.PowerShell.Host.ISE.ISEFile class.

trans-unit.source: This topic lists its member methods and member properties.
trans-unit.target: This topic lists its member methods and member properties.

trans-unit.source: The **$psISE.CurrentFile** and the files in the Files collection in a PowerShell tab are all instances of the Microsoft.PowerShell.Host.ISE.ISEFile class.
trans-unit.target: The **$psISE.CurrentFile** and the files in the Files collection in a PowerShell tab are all instances of the Microsoft.PowerShell.Host.ISE.ISEFile class.

trans-unit.source: Methods
trans-unit.target: Methods

trans-unit.source: Save\( \[saveEncoding\] \)
trans-unit.target: Save\( \[saveEncoding\] \)

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Saves the file to disk.
trans-unit.target: Saves the file to disk.

trans-unit.source: **\[saveEncoding\]** – optional [System.Text.Encoding](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.text.encoding.aspx) An optional character encoding parameter to be used for the saved file.
trans-unit.target: **\[saveEncoding\]** – optional [System.Text.Encoding](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.text.encoding.aspx) An optional character encoding parameter to be used for the saved file.

trans-unit.source: The default value is **UTF8**.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **UTF8**.

trans-unit.source: **Exceptions**
trans-unit.target: **Exceptions**

trans-unit.source: **System.IO.IOException**: The file could not be saved.
trans-unit.target: **System.IO.IOException**: The file could not be saved.

trans-unit.source: SaveAs\(filename, \[saveEncoding\]\)
trans-unit.target: SaveAs\(filename, \[saveEncoding\]\)

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Saves the file with the specified file name and encoding.
trans-unit.target: Saves the file with the specified file name and encoding.

trans-unit.source: **filename** - String The name to be used to save the file.
trans-unit.target: **filename** - String The name to be used to save the file.

trans-unit.source: **\[saveEncoding\]** – optional [System.Text.Encoding](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.text.encoding.aspx) An optional character encoding parameter to be used for the saved file.
trans-unit.target: **\[saveEncoding\]** – optional [System.Text.Encoding](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.text.encoding.aspx) An optional character encoding parameter to be used for the saved file.

trans-unit.source: The default value is **UTF8**.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **UTF8**.

trans-unit.source: **Exceptions**
trans-unit.target: **Exceptions**

trans-unit.source: **System.ArgumentNullException**: The **filename** parameter is null.
trans-unit.target: **System.ArgumentNullException**: The **filename** parameter is null.

trans-unit.source: **System.ArgumentException**: The **filename** parameter is empty.
trans-unit.target: **System.ArgumentException**: The **filename** parameter is empty.

trans-unit.source: **System.IO.IOException**: The file could not be saved.
trans-unit.target: **System.IO.IOException**: The file could not be saved.

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: DisplayName
trans-unit.target: DisplayName

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read-only property that gets the string that contains the display name of this file.
trans-unit.target: The read-only property that gets the string that contains the display name of this file.

trans-unit.source: The name is shown on the **File** tab at the top of the editor.
trans-unit.target: The name is shown on the **File** tab at the top of the editor.

trans-unit.source: The presence of an asterisk \(\*\) at the end of the name indicates that the file has changes that have not been saved.
trans-unit.target: The presence of an asterisk \(\*\) at the end of the name indicates that the file has changes that have not been saved.

trans-unit.source: Editor
trans-unit.target: Editor

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read-only property that gets the [editor object](The-ISEEditor-Object.md) that is used for the specified file.
trans-unit.target: The read-only property that gets the [editor object](The-ISEEditor-Object.md) that is used for the specified file.

trans-unit.source: Encoding
trans-unit.target: Encoding

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read-only property that gets the original file encoding.
trans-unit.target: The read-only property that gets the original file encoding.

trans-unit.source: This is a **System.Text.Encoding** object.
trans-unit.target: This is a **System.Text.Encoding** object.

trans-unit.source: FullPath
trans-unit.target: FullPath

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read-only property that gets the string that specifies the full path of the opened file.
trans-unit.target: The read-only property that gets the string that specifies the full path of the opened file.

trans-unit.source: IsSaved
trans-unit.target: IsSaved

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read-only Boolean property that returns **$true** if the file has been saved after it was last modified.
trans-unit.target: The read-only Boolean property that returns **$true** if the file has been saved after it was last modified.

trans-unit.source: IsUntitled
trans-unit.target: IsUntitled

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read-only property that returns **$true** if the file has never been given a title.
trans-unit.target: The read-only property that returns **$true** if the file has never been given a title.

trans-unit.source: See Also
trans-unit.target: See Also

trans-unit.target: [The ISEFileCollectionObject](The-ISEFileCollection-Object.md) [The Windows PowerShell ISE Scripting Object Model](The-Windows-PowerShell-ISE-Scripting-Object-Model.md) [Windows PowerShell ISE Object Model Reference](Windows-PowerShell-ISE-Object-Model-Reference.md) [The ISE Object Model Hierarchy](The-ISE-Object-Model-Hierarchy.md)
